question: You are a code expert, please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the generated code is executable for display. Create an HTML code for a horror game official website with 2000 lines of code, including customer service information on the right side that can be collapsed/expanded, download links, game introduction, image showcase, a horror website background, scary background music, and dynamic background effects.

checklist.title: Is the horror game official website structure fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the HTML code implements a complete website structure with proper semantic HTML5 tags (header, nav, main, footer), responsive layout (using CSS Grid/Flexbox), and organized sections for all required components (game intro, image showcase, download links, etc). Score 0 if basic structure is missing, 5 if structure exists but with improper semantics, and 10 if properly structured with semantic HTML.

checklist.title: Is the customer service feature implemented as specified?
checklist.description: Check whether the collapsible/expandable customer service component is fully functional on the right side of the website. It should include proper animation transitions, accessibility features (ARIA attributes, keyboard navigation), and contact information. Deduct 5 points if the component doesn't collapse/expand properly, 3 points if it lacks responsive behavior on mobile devices. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are the dynamic horror background effects properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate the quality and performance of background effects. Check for WebGL/Canvas/CSS animations that create horror atmosphere (fog, flickering lights, floating elements, etc.). Effects should be optimized for performance (using requestAnimationFrame, proper canvas rendering). Deduct 5 points if effects cause visible performance issues, 3 points if animations are basic/generic. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the scary background music functionality properly implemented?
checklist.description: Check whether the audio implementation includes: auto-play with user consent mechanism, volume control, mute option, and proper looping without gaps. Audio should preload for seamless playback and include fallback formats. Deduct 5 points if audio controls are missing, 3 points if there's no user consent mechanism for autoplay, and 5 points if mobile implementation is broken. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as image loading failures, audio playback issues, browser compatibility issues, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Interactive horror elements that respond to user actions 2. Randomized jumpscares or events 3. Parallax scrolling with horror themes). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple animation systems doing the same thing) 2. Function modules unrelated to a horror game website (e.g., unrelated social media features) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive particle effects that slow down the page). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating structure/styles/scripts), code organization, use of appropriate design patterns, and browser compatibility. Deduct 5 points if global scope pollution is found; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if there's no progressive enhancement or graceful degradation for older browsers. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional horror design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows horror genre design principles: 1) Dark color scheme with appropriate accent colors for emphasis 2) Typography that enhances the horror theme (gothic/distressed fonts for headings, readable fonts for content) 3) Proper use of negative space to create tension. Deduct 3 points for each visual element that breaks the horror atmosphere, 5 points for overly bright/cheerful color combinations, and 5 points for cluttered layouts that diminish the horror experience. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to horror genre expectations: 1) Subtle hover effects that create unease 2) Transition animations that build suspense (300-800ms duration) 3) Clear visual hierarchy guiding users to key elements. Deduct 5 points for each interaction without appropriate feedback, 3 points for animations that break immersion, and 5 points for confusing navigation that frustrates users. The full score is 10 points.
